channel.title: Height Mask

item.title: Height Mask
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:2, topic:162171”]Pull’en out of an old source:

public void stillgfxz2(int id, int Y, int X, int height, int time) { outStream.createFrame(85); outStream.writeByteC(Y - (mapRegionY * 8)); outStream.writeByteC(X - (mapRegionX * 8)); outStream.createFrame(4); outStream.writeByte(0);//Tiles away (X >> 4 + Y & 7) outStream.writeWord(id);//Graphic id outStream.writeByte(height);//height of the spell above it's basic place, i think it's written in pixels 100 pixels higher outStream.writeWord(time);//Time before casting the graphic } [/quote]

Naw naw… I tried like 6 methods with that in, thats just gfx facing south…
outStream.writeWord(id); causes it to face south… I need the mask…

Read full topic

item.title: Height Mask
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Pull’en out of an old source:

public void stillgfxz2(int id, int Y, int X, int height, int time)
{
     outStream.createFrame(85);
     outStream.writeByteC(Y - (mapRegionY * 8));
     outStream.writeByteC(X - (mapRegionX * 8));
     outStream.createFrame(4);
     outStream.writeByte(0);//Tiles away (X >> 4 + Y & 7)
     outStream.writeWord(id);//Graphic id
     outStream.writeByte(height);//height of the spell above it's basic place, i think it's written in pixels 100 pixels higher
     outStream.writeWord(time);//Time before casting the graphic
}

Read full topic

item.title: Height Mask
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

Does anyone know the height mask? To control height of facing gfx vars?

I.E : mask100var1 = The id of the facing gfx…
mask100var2 = Time/Delay that the ^^ id is created…
mask100update = true; = updates.

Now i need the height mask, to control the height of the facing gfx… So like…

public void playerGfx(int id, int delay, int height) {
mask100var1 = id;
mask100var2 = delay;
HEIGHTMASK = height;
mask100update = true;
updateRequired = true;
}

Many thanks…

Read full topic
